title: What do you mean by intermediate science? - Quora

response.answer_text: 10+2 refers to the 2 years of schooling required post grade 10, currently adopted by high schools in India and Nepal. It is similar to the K12 education system, and equivalent to the International Baccalaureate and General Certificate of Secondary Education levels in the west. 10+2 refers to two years of schooling post grade 10 in India. 10+2 is gradually replacing the conventional modes of intermediate education, being the Intermediate of Science (I. Sc.), Intermediate of Commerce (I. Comm.), Intermediate of Arts/Humanities (I. A.) normally taken by Students after having received their School Leaving Certificate (SLC) provided by Tribhuvan University. for more http://www.easystudypoint.com/
That is u r doing in 10+2 in science
